segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 41
segments.en: Linked Discourses 41

segments.pli: 1. Cittavagga
segments.en: 1. With Citta

segments.pli: 1. Saṃyojanasutta
segments.en: 1. The Fetter

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā therā bhikkhū macchikāsaṇḍe viharanti ambāṭakavane.
segments.en: At one time several senior mendicants were staying near Macchikāsaṇḍa in the Wild Mango Grove.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulānaṃ therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṃ maṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: Now at that time, after the meal, on return from alms-round, several senior mendicants sat together in the pavilion and this discussion came up among them:

segments.pli: “‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā nānatthā nānābyañjanā udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti?
segments.en: “Reverends, the ‘fetter’ and the ‘things prone to being fettered’: do these things differ in both meaning and phrasing? Or do they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing?”

segments.pli: Tatrekaccehi therehi bhikkhūhi evaṃ byākataṃ hoti:
segments.en: Some senior mendicants answered like this:

segments.pli: “‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā cā”ti.
segments.en: “Reverends, the ‘fetter’ and the ‘things prone to being fettered’: these things differ in both meaning and phrasing.”

segments.pli: Ekaccehi therehi bhikkhūhi evaṃ byākataṃ hoti:
segments.en: But some senior mendicants answered like this:

segments.pli: “‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti.
segments.en: “Reverends, the ‘fetter’ and the ‘things prone to being fettered’ mean the same thing; they differ only in the phrasing.”

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena citto gahapati migapathakaṃ anuppatto hoti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
segments.en: Now at that time the householder Citta had arrived at Migapathaka on some business.

segments.pli: Assosi kho citto gahapati sambahulānaṃ kira therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṃ maṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: He heard about what those senior mendicants were discussing.

segments.pli: “‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā nānatthā nānābyañjanā udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti?
Tatrekaccehi therehi bhikkhūhi evaṃ byākataṃ:
“‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā cā”ti.
Ekaccehi therehi bhikkhūhi evaṃ byākataṃ:
“‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti.
Atha kho citto gahapati yena therā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā there bhikkhū abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho citto gahapati there bhikkhū etadavoca:
segments.en: So he went up to them, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to them,

segments.pli: “sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante, sambahulānaṃ kira therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṃ maṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: “Sirs, I heard that you were discussing whether the ‘fetter’ and the ‘things prone to being fettered’ differ in both meaning and phrasing, or whether they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing.”

segments.pli: ‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā nānatthā nānābyañjanā udāhu ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti?
Ekaccehi therehi bhikkhūhi evaṃ byākataṃ:
“‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā cā”ti.
Ekaccehi therehi bhikkhūhi evaṃ byākataṃ “‘saṃyojanan’ti vā, āvuso, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā ekatthā byañjanameva nānan”ti.
“Evaṃ, gahapatī”ti.
segments.en: “That’s right, householder.”

segments.pli: “‘Saṃyojanan’ti vā, bhante, ‘saṃyojaniyā dhammā’ti vā ime dhammā nānatthā ceva nānābyañjanā ca.
segments.en: “Sirs, the ‘fetter’ and the ‘things prone to being fettered’: these things differ in both meaning and phrasing.

segments.pli: Tena hi, bhante, upamaṃ vo karissāmi.
segments.en: Well then, sirs, I shall give you a simile.

segments.pli: Upamāyapidhekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānanti.
segments.en: For by means of a simile some sensible people understand the meaning of what is said.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, kāḷo ca balībaddo odāto ca balībaddo ekena dāmena vā yottena vā saṃyuttā assu.
segments.en: Suppose there was a black ox and a white ox yoked by a single harness or yoke.

segments.pli: Yo nu kho evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: Would it be right to say that

segments.pli: ‘kāḷo balībaddo odātassa balībaddassa saṃyojanaṃ, odāto balībaddo kāḷassa balībaddassa saṃyojanan’ti, sammā nu kho so vadamāno vadeyyā”ti?
segments.en: the black ox is the yoke of the white ox, or the white ox is the yoke of the black ox?”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, gahapati.
segments.en: “No, householder.

segments.pli: Na kho, gahapati, kāḷo balībaddo odātassa balībaddassa saṃyojanaṃ, napi odāto balībaddo kāḷassa balībaddassa saṃyojanaṃ;
segments.en: The black ox is not the yoke of the white ox, nor is the white ox the yoke of the black ox.

segments.pli: yena kho te ekena dāmena vā yottena vā saṃyuttā taṃ tattha saṃyojanan”ti.
segments.en: The yoke there is the single harness or yoke that they’re yoked by.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhante, na cakkhu rūpānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na rūpā cakkhussa saṃyojanaṃ;
segments.en: “In the same way, the eye is not the fetter of sights, nor are sights the fetter of the eye.

segments.pli: yañca tattha tadubhayaṃ paṭicca uppajjati chandarāgo taṃ tattha saṃyojanaṃ.
segments.en: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.

segments.pli: Na sotaṃ saddānaṃ …
segments.en: The ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: na ghānaṃ gandhānaṃ …
na jivhā rasānaṃ …
na kāyo phoṭṭhabbānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na phoṭṭhabbā kāyassa saṃyojanaṃ;
yañca tattha tadubhayaṃ paṭicca uppajjati chandarāgo taṃ tattha saṃyojanaṃ.
Na mano dhammānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ, na dhammā manassa saṃyojanaṃ;
segments.en: mind is not the fetter of thoughts, nor are thoughts the fetter of the mind.

segments.pli: yañca tattha tadubhayaṃ paṭicca uppajjati chandarāgo taṃ tattha saṃyojanan”ti.
segments.en: The fetter there is the desire and greed that arises from the pair of them.”

segments.pli: “Lābhā te, gahapati, suladdhaṃ te, gahapati,
segments.en: “You’re fortunate, householder, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: yassa te gambhīre buddhavacane paññācakkhu kamatī”ti.
segments.en: to traverse the Buddha’s deep teachings with the eye of wisdom.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time several senior mendicants were staying near…

suttaplex.blurb: Citta the householder hears of a conversation among the monks regarding the distinction between the fetters and the things that are fettered. He goes to ask them on this topic, but they are unable to give a satisfactory answer, so he explained it to them. It is desire that is the fetter, like the yoke that binds two oxen.
